none: media/user/SCRAPE/test/2012-02-bliss-pocket-opera/extracted/Tribal Dance demo 1988/A4 Merry Go Round Games
Bliss The Pocket Opera - Tribal Dance demo 1988
Bliss The Pocket Opera - Tribal Dance demo 1988

Originally ripped by Terminal Escape, posted on February 19, 2012 Description from Terminal Escape:
Listening in the future, these songs could have easily been from any number of second tier late '80s goth bands - vocals wailing like a banshee over morose indulgent music. There is an attempt to highlight the guitar in a couple of tracks, which helps them come off with more of an edge than they probably intended, but the star on 1988's Tribal Dance is "Paradise Island" with it's COCTEAU TWINS meets Jimmy Sommerville on quaaludes vocal delivery. Go ahead, we won't tell the punks. TRIBAL DANCE
//4.bp.blogspot.com/-FQY_-Agqp7w/T0E4ifduBlI/AAAAAAAACZw/yWOBnPr2jpo/s1600/bliss+the+pocket+opera+cover+copy.jpg //4.bp.blogspot.com/-tmw1jww6CXc/T0E72IjCC9I/AAAAAAAACZ4/Sccro4XTHvE/s1600/bliss+the+pocket+opera+img+copy.jpg
